intro: Calceolaria × youngii, commonly known as the hybrid slipper orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, cool environments and thrives in partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters on long, slender stems. Calceolaria × youngii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
